Badge.name: Badge
Badge.description: Small status label for categorizing or highlighting content.

variant.description:
Visual style of the badge.
- `"primary"` — High-emphasis badge for important labels
- `"secondary"` — Subtle badge for secondary information
- `"destructive"` — Error or danger state indicator
- `"outline"` — Bordered badge with transparent background
- `"beta"` — Dashed-border badge for beta/experimental features

descriptions.primary: Default high-emphasis badge for important labels

examples: Primary Secondary Destructive Outline Beta
<Badge variant="primary">Primary</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Secondary</Badge>
<Badge variant="destructive">Destructive</Badge>
<Badge variant="outline">Outline</Badge>
<Badge variant="beta">Beta</Badge>
Workers Beta
Badge.baseStyles: inline-flex w-fit flex-none shrink-0 items-center justify-self-start rounded-full px-2 py-0.5 text-xs font-medium whitespace-nowrap

Banner.name: Banner
Banner.description: Full-width message bar for informational, warning, or error notices.

icon.description: Icon element rendered before the banner text (e.g. from `@phosphor-icons/react`).

children.description: Banner message content. Accepts strings or custom React elements.

variant.description:
Visual style of the banner.
- `"default"` — Informational blue banner for general messages
- `"alert"` — Warning yellow banner for cautionary messages
- `"error"` — Error red banner for critical issues

examples: This is an informational banner. This is an alert banner. This is an error banner.
<Banner>This is an informational banner.</Banner>
<Banner variant="alert">Your session will expire soon.</Banner>
<Banner variant="error">We couldn't save your changes.</Banner>

<Banner icon={<WarningCircle />} variant="alert">
      Review your billing information.
    </Banner>
}> This banner supports custom content with Text.
Banner.baseStyles: flex w-full items-center gap-2 rounded-lg border px-4 py-1.5 text-base

Breadcrumbs.name: Breadcrumbs

size.description:
Size of the breadcrumbs.
- `"sm"` — Compact breadcrumbs for dense UIs
- `"base"` — Default breadcrumbs size

examples:
<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Docs</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Breadcrumbs</Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#" icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Home
      </Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Projects</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Current Project</Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#" icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Home
      </Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Docs</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current loading></Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Current icon={<House size={16} />}>
        Worker Analytics
      </Breadcrumbs.Current>
    </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs>
      <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
      <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
      <Breadcrumbs.Current>Breadcrumbs</Breadcrumbs.Current>
      <Breadcrumbs.Clipboard text="#" />
    </Breadcrumbs>

Button.name: Button
Button.description: Primary action trigger. Supports multiple variants, sizes, shapes, icons, and loading state.

descriptions.xs: Extra small button for compact UIs

descriptions.secondary: Default button style for most actions
descriptions.destructive: Danger button for destructive actions like delete
descriptions.secondary-destructive: Secondary button with destructive text for less prominent dangerous actions

classes.secondary: bg-kumo-control !text-kumo-default ring not-disabled:hover:border-secondary! not-disabled:hover:bg-kumo-control disabled:bg-kumo-control/50 disabled:!text-kumo-default/70 ring-kumo-line data-[state=open]:bg-kumo-control
classes.secondary-destructive: bg-kumo-control !text-kumo-danger ring not-disabled:hover:border-secondary! not-disabled:hover:bg-kumo-control disabled:bg-kumo-control/50 disabled:!text-kumo-danger/70 ring-kumo-line data-[state=open]:bg-kumo-control

icon.description: Icon from `@phosphor-icons/react` or a React element. Rendered before children.

loading.description: Shows a loading spinner and disables interaction.

examples: <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
<Button variant="ghost">Ghost</Button>
<Button variant="destructive">Destructive</Button>
<Button variant="outline">Outline</Button>
<Button variant="secondary-destructive">Secondary Destructive</Button>

<Button variant="secondary" icon={PlusIcon}>
      Create Worker
    </Button>

<Button variant="primary" loading>
      Loading...
    </Button>

<Button variant="secondary" disabled>
      Disabled
    </Button>

Checkbox.name: Checkbox

variant.description: Visual variant: "default" or "error" for validation failures (visual only, no error text)

label.description: Label content for the checkbox (enables built-in Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

controlFirst.description: When true (default), checkbox appears before label. When false, label appears before checkbox.

indeterminate.description: Whether the checkbox is in indeterminate state

examples:
<Checkbox
      label="Accept terms and conditions"
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />

<Checkbox
      label="Enable notifications"
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />
<Checkbox label="I agree" checked={checked} onCheckedChange={setChecked} />

<Checkbox
      label="Select all"
      indeterminate={indeterminate}
      onCheckedChange={setIndeterminate}
    />

<Checkbox
      label="Remember me"
      controlFirst={false}
      checked={checked}
      onCheckedChange={setChecked}
    />
<Checkbox label="Disabled option" disabled />
<Checkbox label="Invalid option" variant="error" />

<Checkbox.Group
      legend="Email preferences"
      description="Choose how you'd like to receive updates"
      value={preferences}
      onValueChange={setPreferences}
    >
      <Checkbox.Item value="email" label="Email notifications" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="sms" label="SMS notifications" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="push" label="Push notifications" />
    </Checkbox.Group>

<Checkbox.Group
      legend="Required preferences"
      error="Please select at least one notification method"
      value={[]}
      onValueChange={() => {}}
    >
      <Checkbox.Item value="email" label="Email" variant="error" />
      <Checkbox.Item value="sms" label="SMS" variant="error" />
    </Checkbox.Group>

ClipboardText.name: ClipboardText
ClipboardText.description: Read-only text field with a one-click copy-to-clipboard button.

size.description:
Size of the clipboard text field.
- `"sm"` — Small clipboard text for compact UIs
- `"base"` — Default clipboard text size
- `"lg"` — Large clipboard text for prominent display

descriptions.sm: Small clipboard text for compact UIs
descriptions.lg: Large clipboard text for prominent display

text.description: The text to display and copy to clipboard.

examples: <ClipboardText text="0c239dd2" />
<ClipboardText text="abc123" />
<ClipboardText text="sk_live_51H8..." />
<ClipboardText text="https://example.com/very/long/url/path" />

CloudflareLogo.name: CloudflareLogo

variant.description:
Logo variant
- `glyph`: Cloud icon only
- `full`: Cloud icon with "CLOUDFLARE" wordmark below

descriptions.full: Full logo with cloud glyph and wordmark stacked

examples: <CloudflareLogo className="w-72" />
<CloudflareLogo variant="glyph" className="w-24" />

copyToClipboard( generateCloudflareLogoSvg({ variant: "glyph" }), "glyph", ) } > {copied === "glyph" ? "Copied!" : "Copy logo as SVG"} copyToClipboard( generateCloudflareLogoSvg({ variant: "full" }), "full", ) } > {copied === "full" ? "Copied!" : "Copy full logo as SVG"} window.open( "https://www.cloudflare.com/press-kit/", "_blank", "noopener", ) } > Download brand assets window.open( "https://www.cloudflare.com/brand-assets/", "_blank", "noopener", ) } > Visit brand guidelines Click to open the brand assets menu
<PoweredByCloudflare />
© 2026 Your Company. All rights reserved.

Code.name: Code

lang.description:
Language hint for the code content.
- `"ts"` — TypeScript code
- `"tsx"` — TypeScript JSX code
- `"jsonc"` — JSON with comments
- `"bash"` — Shell/Bash commands
- `"css"` — CSS styles

values.description: Template values for `{{key}}` interpolation. Values with `highlight: true` are visually emphasized.

examples:
<CodeBlock
      lang="tsx"
      code={`const greeting = "Hello, World!";
console.log(greeting);`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="tsx"
      code={`interface User {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  email: string;
}

const user: User = {
  id: "1",
  name: "John Doe",
  email: "john@example.com"
};`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="bash"
      code={`npm install @cloudflare/kumo
pnpm add @cloudflare/kumo`}
    />

<CodeBlock
      lang="jsonc"
      code={`{
  "name": "kumo",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "dependencies": {
    "react": "^19.0.0"
  }
}`}
    />

<Code
      lang="bash"
      code="export API_KEY={{apiKey}}"
      values={{
        apiKey: { value: "sk_live_123", highlight: true },
      }}
    />

Collapsible.name: Collapsible
Collapsible.description: Collapsible component for showing/hiding content.  Features: - Animated chevron indicator (rotates 180° when open) - Accessible with aria-expanded and aria-controls - Content panel with left border accent

label.description: Text label displayed in the trigger button

open.description: Whether the collapsible content is visible

className.description: Additional CSS classes for the content panel

examples: Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system.
Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system.
Kumo is Cloudflare's new design system. Install the components and import them into your project. Check the repository for license information.

Combobox.name: Combobox
Combobox.description: Combobox — autocomplete input with filterable dropdown list.  Compound component: `Combobox` (Root), `.TriggerInput`, `.TriggerValue`, `.TriggerMultipleWithInput`, `.Content`, `.Item`, `.Chip`, `.Input`, `.Empty`, `.GroupLabel`, `.Group`, `.List`, `.Collection`.

inputSide.description:
Position of the text input relative to chips in multi-select mode.
- `"right"` — Input inline to the right of chips
- `"top"` — Input above chips

descriptions.right: Input positioned inline to the right of chips

items.description: Array of items to display in the dropdown

label.description: Label content for the combobox (enables Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the combobox

error.description: Error message or validation error object

isItemEqualToValue.description: Custom equality function for comparing items

examples:
<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      items={fruits}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerInput placeholder="Please select" />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(item: string) => (
            <Combobox.Item key={item} value={item}>
              {item}
            </Combobox.Item>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as Language)}
      items={languages}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerValue className="w-[200px]" />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Input placeholder="Search languages" />
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(item: Language) => (
            <Combobox.Item key={item.value} value={item}>
              {item.emoji} {item.label}
            </Combobox.Item>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

<Combobox
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as ServerLocation | null)}
      items={servers}
    >
      <Combobox.TriggerInput
        className="w-[200px]"
        placeholder="Select server"
      />
      <Combobox.Content>
        <Combobox.Empty />
        <Combobox.List>
          {(group: ServerLocationGroup) => (
            <Combobox.Group key={group.value} items={group.items}>
              <Combobox.GroupLabel>{group.value}</Combobox.GroupLabel>
              <Combobox.Collection>
                {(item: ServerLocation) => (
                  <Combobox.Item key={item.value} value={item}>
                    {item.label}
                  </Combobox.Item>
                )}
              </Combobox.Collection>
            </Combobox.Group>
          )}
        </Combobox.List>
      </Combobox.Content>
    </Combobox>

bot.value === selected.value } multiple > ( {selected.label} )} inputSide="right" /> {(item: BotItem) => (
{item.label} {item.author}
)}
{(item: DatabaseItem) => ( {item.label} )}
{(item: DatabaseItem) => ( {item.label} )}

List.name: List
List.description: A container for combobox items. Supports render prop for custom item rendering.

children.description: Items to render, or a function that receives each item and returns a node

Collection.name: Collection
Collection.description: Renders filtered list items. Use when you need more control over item rendering.

children.description: Function that receives each filtered item and returns a node

Built on `@base-ui/react/autocomplete` + `@base-ui/react/dialog`.

children.description: Child content - typically one or more Panel components

DatePicker.name: DatePicker
DatePicker.description: DatePicker — a date selection calendar.  Built on [react-day-picker](https://daypicker.dev) with Kumo styling. Supports three selection modes: single, multiple, and range.
examples:
{ if (d) { setDate(d); } }} />

DateRangePicker.name: DateRangePicker
DateRangePicker.description: DateRangePicker — dual-calendar date range selector.  Renders two side-by-side month calendars with click-to-select start/end dates, hover preview of the range, a timezone footer, and a reset button.

size.description:
Calendar size.
- `"sm"` — Compact calendar for tight spaces
- `"base"` — Default calendar size
- `"lg"` — Large calendar for prominent date selection

descriptions.lg: Large calendar for prominent date selection

variant.description:
Visual variant.
- `"default"` — Standard appearance with overlay background
- `"subtle"` — Minimal background

timezone.description: Display timezone string shown in the footer.

Dialog.name: Dialog

children.description: Dialog content (typically Title, Description, Close, and action buttons).

size.description:
Dialog width.
- `"sm"` — Small (min 288px) for simple confirmations
- `"base"` — Default (min 384px)
- `"lg"` — Large (min 512px) for complex content
- `"xl"` — Extra large (min 768px) for detailed views

DropdownMenu.name: DropdownMenu
DropdownMenu.description: DropdownMenu — accessible dropdown menu anchored to a trigger.  Compound component: `DropdownMenu` (Root), `.Trigger`, `.Content`, `.Item`, `.CheckboxItem`, `.RadioGroup`, `.RadioItem`, `.RadioItemIndicator`, `.Sub`, `.SubTrigger`, `.SubContent`, `.Label`, `.Separator`, `.Shortcut`, `.Group`.  Built on `@base-ui/react/menu`.

variant.description:
Visual style of the dropdown item.
- `"default"` — Standard item appearance
- `"danger"` — Destructive action with red text

Empty.name: Empty
Empty.description: Placeholder shown when a list, table, or page has no content to display.

size.description:
Size of the empty state container.
- `"sm"` — Compact empty state for smaller containers
- `"base"` — Default empty state size
- `"lg"` — Large empty state for prominent placement

descriptions.sm: Compact empty state for smaller containers
descriptions.lg: Large empty state for prominent placement

icon.description: Decorative icon displayed above the title (e.g. from `@phosphor-icons/react`).

title.description: Primary heading text for the empty state.

description.description: Secondary description text displayed below the title.

commandLine.description: Shell command displayed in a copyable code block.

contents.description: Additional content (buttons, links) rendered below the description.

examples:
} title="No packages found" description="Get started by installing your first package." commandLine="npm install @cloudflare/kumo" contents={

Field.name: Field
Field.description: Form field wrapper that provides a label, optional description, and error display around any form control. Built on Base UI Field primitives.

controlFirst.description: When `true`, places the control before the label (for checkbox/switch layouts).

children.description: The form control element(s) to wrap (Input, Select, Checkbox, etc.).

label.description: The label content — can be a string or any React node.

required.description: When explicitly `false`, shows gray "(optional)" text after the label. When `true` or `undefined`, no indicator is shown.

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content displayed next to the label via an info icon.

error.description: Validation error with a message and a browser `ValidityState` match key.

description.description: Helper text displayed below the control (hidden when `error` is present).

Grid.name: Grid
Grid.description: Responsive CSS grid layout container with preset column configurations.

mobileDivider.description: Show dividers between grid items on mobile (only works with `"4up"` variant).

gap.description:
Gap size between grid items.
- `"none"` — No gap
- `"sm"` — 12px gap
- `"base"` — Responsive gap (8px → 24px → 32px)
- `"lg"` — 32px gap

descriptions.base: Default responsive gap between grid items

variant.description:
Responsive column layout variant.
- `"2up"` — 1 col → 2 cols at md
- `"side-by-side"` — Always 2 cols
- `"2-1"` — 66%/33% split at md
- `"1-2"` — 33%/66% split at md
- `"3up"` — 1 → 2 → 3 cols
- `"4up"` — 1 → 2 → 3 → 4 cols
- `"6up"` — 2 → 3 → 4 → 6 cols
- `"1-2-4up"` — 1 → 2 → 4 cols

descriptions.2up: Grid items stack on small screens, display side-by-side on medium screens and up
descriptions.2-1: Two-thirds / one-third split (66%/33%) on medium screens and up
descriptions.1-2: One-third / two-thirds split (33%/66%) on medium screens and up
descriptions.1-3up: Grid items stack on small screens, expand to 3 across on large screens
descriptions.3up: Grid items stack on small screens, 2 across on medium, 3 across on large
descriptions.4up: Grid items stack on small screens, progressively increase columns at larger breakpoints
descriptions.6up: Grid items start at 2 across, expand to 6 across on XL
descriptions.1-2-4up: Grid items stack on small screens, 2 across on medium, 4 across on large

examples:
Item 1
First grid item
Item 2
Second grid item

Input.name: Input

label.description: Label content for the input (enables Field wrapper) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the input

error.description: Error message or validation error object

size.description:
Input size.
- `"xs"` — Extra small for compact UIs
- `"sm"` — Small for secondary fields
- `"base"` — Default size
- `"lg"` — Large for prominent fields

descriptions.xs: Extra small input for compact UIs

variant.description:
Visual variant.
- `"default"` — Standard input
- `"error"` — Error state for validation failures

examples:
<Input
      label="Email"
      placeholder="you@example.com"
      description="We'll never share your email"
    />

<Input
      label="Username"
      placeholder="Choose a username"
      description="3-20 characters, alphanumeric only"
    />

<Input
      label="Email"
      placeholder="you@example.com"
      value="invalid-email"
      variant="error"
      error="Please enter a valid email address"
    />

<Input
      label="Password"
      type="password"
      value="short"
      variant="error"
      error={{
        message: "Password must be at least 8 characters",
        match: "tooShort",
      }}
      minLength={8}
    />
<Input label="Disabled field" placeholder="Cannot edit" disabled />
<Input placeholder="Search..." aria-label="Search products" />

<Input
      label="Phone Number"
      required={false}
      placeholder="+1 (555) 000-0000"
    />

<Input
      label="API Key"
      labelTooltip="Find this in your dashboard under Settings > API Keys"
      placeholder="sk_live_..."
    />
Email for billing } required placeholder="billing@company.com" type="email" />

Label.name: Label
Label.description: Label component for form fields.  Provides a standardized way to display labels with optional indicators: - Optional indicator: gray "(optional)" text when `showOptional={true}` - Tooltip: info icon with hover tooltip for additional context

children.description: The label content — can be a string or any React node.

showOptional.description: When `true`, shows gray "(optional)" text after the label.

tooltip.description: Tooltip content displayed next to the label via an info icon.

htmlFor.description: The id of the form element this label is associated with

asContent.description: When true, only renders the inline content (indicators, tooltip) without the outer label element with font styling. Useful when composed inside another label element that already provides the text styling.

examples: <Input label="Phone Number" required={false} placeholder="+1 555-0000" />

<Input
      label="API Key"
      labelTooltip="Find this in your dashboard settings under API > Keys"
      placeholder="sk_live_..."
    />
I agree to the Terms of Service } />

LayerCard.name: LayerCard
examples:
Next Steps
 Get started with Kumo

Getting Started

Quick start guide for new users

Components

Browse all components

 Examples

View code examples

Link.name: Link

variant.description:
Visual style of the link.
- `"inline"` — Inline text link that flows with content
- `"current"` — Link that inherits color from parent text
- `"plain"` — Link without underline decoration

descriptions.inline: Inline text link that flows with content
descriptions.current: Link that inherits color from parent text

classes.inline: text-primary underline underline-offset-[0.15em] decoration-[0.0625em] link-current transition-colors
classes.current: text-current underline underline-offset-[0.15em] decoration-[0.0625em] link-current transition-colors

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

examples: Default inline link Current color link Plain inline link
This is a paragraph with an inline link that flows naturally with the surrounding text. Links maintain proper underline offset for readability.

<Link
      href="https://cloudflare.com"
      target="_blank"
      rel="noopener noreferrer"
      className="text-base"
    >
      Visit Cloudflare <Link.ExternalIcon />
    </Link>
This error message contains a{" "} link {" "} that inherits the red color from its parent.
} variant="inline"> Dashboard (via render) } variant="inline" > Cloudflare Docs

Loader.name: Loader
Loader.description: Animated circular spinner for indicating loading states.

size.description:
Size of the spinner. Use a preset name or a custom pixel number.
- `"sm"` — 16px, for inline use
- `"base"` — 24px, default size
- `"lg"` — 32px, for prominent loading states

descriptions.lg: Large loader for prominent loading states

examples: <Loader />
<Loader size={24} />

MenuBar.name: MenuBar
MenuBar.description: MenuBar — horizontal icon-button toolbar with keyboard arrow-key navigation.  Each option renders as a `<button>` with a Tooltip. The active option is visually highlighted with an elevated background.

isActive.description: The currently active option value — matched against option index or `id`.

optionIds.description: When true, each option's `id` field is used for matching instead of its array index.

examples:
<MenuBar
      isActive="bold"
      optionIds
      options={[
        {
          icon: <TextBolderIcon />,
          id: "bold",
          tooltip: "Bold",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
        {
          icon: <TextItalicIcon />,
          id: "italic",
          tooltip: "Italic",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
      ]}
    />

<MenuBar
      isActive="bold"
      optionIds
      options={[
        {
          icon: <TextBolderIcon />,
          id: "bold",
          tooltip: "Bold",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
        {
          icon: <TextItalicIcon />,
          id: "italic",
          tooltip: "Italic",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
      ]}
    />

<MenuBar
      isActive=""
      optionIds
      options={[
        {
          icon: <TextBolderIcon />,
          id: "bold",
          tooltip: "Bold",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
        {
          icon: <TextItalicIcon />,
          id: "italic",
          tooltip: "Italic",
          onClick: () => {},
        },
      ]}
    />

Meter.name: Meter
Meter.description: Progress bar showing a measured value within a known range (e.g. quota usage).

customValue.description: Custom formatted value text (e.g. "750 / 1,000") displayed instead of percentage.

label.description: Label text displayed above the meter track.

showValue.description: Whether to display the percentage value next to the label.

trackClassName.description: Additional CSS classes for the track (background bar).

indicatorClassName.description: Additional CSS classes for the indicator (filled bar).

examples: <Meter label="Storage used" value={65} />
<Meter label="API requests" value={75} customValue="750 / 1,000" />
<Meter label="Progress" value={40} showValue={false} />
<Meter label="Quota reached" value={100} />
<Meter label="Memory usage" value={15} />

<Meter
      label="Upload progress"
      value={80}
      indicatorClassName="from-green-500 via-green-500 to-green-500"
    />

Pagination.name: Pagination
Pagination.description: Page navigation controls with page count display.

descriptions.full: Full pagination controls with first, previous, page input, next, and last buttons
descriptions.simple: Simple pagination controls with only previous and next buttons

perPage.description: Number of items displayed per page.

totalCount.description: Total number of items across all pages.

text.description: Method to provide custom pagination text

examples: <Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={10} totalCount={100} />

<Pagination
      page={page}
      setPage={setPage}
      perPage={10}
      totalCount={100}
      controls="simple"
    />

<Pagination
      page={page}
      setPage={setPage}
      perPage={10}
      totalCount={100}
      controls="full"
    />
<Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={10} totalCount={100} />
<Pagination page={page} setPage={setPage} perPage={25} totalCount={1250} />

<Pagination
      text={({ perPage }) => `Page ${page} - showing ${perPage} per page`}
      page={page}
      setPage={setPage}
      perPage={25}
      totalCount={100}
    />

Popover.name: Popover
Popover.description: Popover component for displaying accessible popup content anchored to a trigger.

side.description:
Which side of the trigger the popover appears on.
- `"top"` — Above the trigger
- `"bottom"` — Below the trigger
- `"left"` — Left of the trigger
- `"right"` — Right of the trigger

descriptions.left: Popover appears to the left of the trigger
descriptions.right: Popover appears to the right of the trigger

examples:
<Popover>
      <Popover.Trigger asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={BellIcon} aria-label="Notifications" />
      </Popover.Trigger>
      <Popover.Content>
        <Popover.Title>Notifications</Popover.Title>
        <Popover.Description>
          You are all caught up. Good job!
        </Popover.Description>
      </Popover.Content>
    </Popover>

<Popover>
      <Popover.Trigger asChild>
        <Button>Open Popover</Button>
      </Popover.Trigger>
      <Popover.Content>
        <Popover.Title>Popover Title</Popover.Title>
        <Popover.Description>
          This is a basic popover with a title and description.
        </Popover.Description>
      </Popover.Content>
    </Popover>
Settings Configure your preferences below.
Bottom Popover on bottom (default). Top Popover on top. Left Popover on left. Right Popover on right.

Jane Doe

jane@example.com
Hover Triggered This popover opens on hover with a 200ms delay. It can still contain interactive content like buttons and links.

Radio.name: Radio
Radio.description: Radio — radio button group for single-select choices.  Compound component: `Radio.Group` (with built-in Fieldset) and `Radio.Item`. Built on `@base-ui/react/radio-group` + `@base-ui/react/radio`.

legend.description: Legend text for the group (required for accessibility)

orientation.description: Layout direction of the radio items

value.description: Value of the radio that should be selected (controlled)

disabled.description: Whether all radios in the group are disabled

controlPosition.description: Position of radio control relative to label: "start" (default) puts radio before label, "end" puts label before radio

name.description: Form submission name for the radio group

examples:
<Radio.Group
      legend="Notification preference"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Email" value="email" />
      <Radio.Item label="SMS" value="sms" />
      <Radio.Item label="Push notification" value="push" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group legend="Account type" value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
      <Radio.Item label="Personal" value="personal" />
      <Radio.Item label="Business" value="business" />
      <Radio.Item label="Enterprise" value="enterprise" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Size"
      orientation="horizontal"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Small" value="sm" />
      <Radio.Item label="Medium" value="md" />
      <Radio.Item label="Large" value="lg" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Shipping method"
      description="Choose how you'd like to receive your order"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={setValue}
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Standard (5-7 days)" value="standard" />
      <Radio.Item label="Express (2-3 days)" value="express" />
      <Radio.Item label="Overnight" value="overnight" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group
      legend="Payment method"
      error="Please select a payment method to continue"
    >
      <Radio.Item label="Credit Card" value="card" variant="error" />
      <Radio.Item label="PayPal" value="paypal" variant="error" />
      <Radio.Item label="Bank Transfer" value="bank" variant="error" />
    </Radio.Group>

<Radio.Group legend="Preferences" controlPosition="end" defaultValue="a">
      <Radio.Item label="Label before radio" value="a" />
      <Radio.Item label="Another option" value="b" />
    </Radio.Group>

Select.name: Select

label.description: Label content for the select (enables Field wrapper) — can be a string or any React node.

hideLabel.description: Visually hide the label while keeping it accessible to screen readers. Set to `false` to show a visible label above the select via the Field wrapper.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown when no value is selected.

loading.description: When `true`, shows a skeleton loader in place of the selected value.

required.description: Whether the select is required. When `false`, shows "(optional)" text.

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content displayed next to the label via an info icon.

children.description: `Select.Option` elements to render in the dropdown.

description.description: Helper text displayed below the select.

error.description: Error message string or validation error object with `match` key.

examples:
<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v ?? "apple")}
      items={{ apple: "Apple", banana: "Banana", cherry: "Cherry" }}
    >
      <Select.Option value="apple">Apple</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="banana">Banana</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="cherry">Cherry</Select.Option>
    </Select>

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string)}
      items={{
        bug: "Bug",
        documentation: "Documentation",
        feature: "Feature",
      }}
    >
      <Select.Option value="bug">Bug</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="documentation">Documentation</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="feature">Feature</Select.Option>
    </Select>

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      items={[
        { value: null, label: "Please select" },
        { value: "bug", label: "Bug" },
        { value: "documentation", label: "Documentation" },
        { value: "feature", label: "Feature" },
      ]}
    >
      <Select.Option value="bug">Bug</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="documentation">Documentation</Select.Option>
      <Select.Option value="feature">Feature</Select.Option>
    </Select>
<Select className="w-[200px]" loading />

<Select
      className="w-[200px]"
      loading={loading}
      value={value}
      onValueChange={(v) => setValue(v as string | null)}
      placeholder="Please select"
    >
      {data?.map((item) => (
        <Select.Option key={item} value={item}>
          {item}
        </Select.Option>
      ))}
    </Select>

SensitiveInput.name: SensitiveInput
SensitiveInput.description: Password/secret input that masks its value by default and reveals on click. Includes a built-in copy-to-clipboard button on hover.

size.description:
Size of the input.
- `"xs"` — Extra small for compact UIs
- `"sm"` — Small for secondary fields
- `"base"` — Default input size
- `"lg"` — Large for prominent fields

variant.description:
Style variant of the input.
- `"default"` — Default input appearance
- `"error"` — Error state for validation failures

label.description: Label content for the input (enables Field wrapper and sets masked state label) - can be a string or any React node

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

description.description: Helper text displayed below the input

error.description: Error message or validation error object

examples:
{sizes.map((size) => (
{size}
))}
Current value: {value}

Surface.name: Surface

as.description: The HTML element type to render as (e.g. `"div"`, `"section"`, `"article"`).

examples:
Surface Component
A container with consistent elevation and border styling.
As section element As article element As aside element

<Surface className="rounded-lg p-6">
      <Text bold>Outer Surface</Text>
      <Surface className="mt-4 rounded-md bg-kumo-elevated p-4">
        <Text variant="secondary">Nested Surface</Text>
      </Surface>
    </Surface>

Switch.name: Switch

variant.description: Visual variant: "default" or "error" for validation failures (visual only, no error text)

label.description: Label content for the switch (Field wrapper is built-in) - can be a string or any React node. Optional when used standalone for visual-only purposes.

labelTooltip.description: Tooltip content to display next to the label via an info icon

required.description: Whether the switch is required. When explicitly false, shows "(optional)" text after the label.

controlFirst.description: When true (default), switch appears before label. When false, label appears before switch.

examples: <Switch label="Switch" checked={checked} onCheckedChange={setChecked} />
<Switch label="Switch" checked={false} onCheckedChange={() => {}} />
<Switch label="Switch" checked={true} onCheckedChange={() => {}} />
<Switch label="Disabled" checked={false} disabled />

Table.name: Table
Table.description: Table — semantic HTML table with styled rows, cells, and selection support.  Compound component: `Table` (Root), `.Header`, `.Head`, `.Body`, `.Row`, `.Cell`, `.Footer`, `.CheckCell`, `.CheckHead`, `.ResizeHandle`.

descriptions.auto: Auto table layout - columns resize based on content
descriptions.fixed: Fixed table layout - columns have equal width, controlled via colgroup

examples: Subject From Date {emailData.slice(0, 3).map((row) => ( {row.subject} {row.from} {row.date} ))}
Subject From Date {emailData.slice(0, 3).map((row) => ( {row.subject} {row.from} {row.date} ))}

{row.tags.map((tag) => ( {tag} ))}

Tabs.name: Tabs
Tabs.description: Tab navigation component with segmented or underline style. Built on Base UI Tabs with animated active indicator.

tabs.description: Array of tab items to render.

value.description: Controlled value. When set, component becomes controlled.

selectedValue.description: Default selected value for uncontrolled mode. Ignored when `value` is set.

activateOnFocus.description: When `true`, tabs are activated immediately upon receiving focus via arrow keys. When `false` (default), tabs receive focus but require Enter/Space to activate.

className.description: Additional CSS classes for the root element.

listClassName.description: Additional CSS classes for the tab list element.

indicatorClassName.description: Additional CSS classes for the indicator element.

variant.description:
Tab style.
- `"segmented"` — Pill-shaped indicator on a filled track
- `"underline"` — Underline indicator below tab text

examples:
Segmented (default)

Underline

<Tabs
      variant="segmented"
      tabs={[
        { value: "tab1", label: "Tab 1" },
        { value: "tab2", label: "Tab 2" },
        { value: "tab3", label: "Tab 3" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />

<Tabs
      variant="underline"
      tabs={[
        { value: "tab1", label: "Tab 1" },
        { value: "tab2", label: "Tab 2" },
        { value: "tab3", label: "Tab 3" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />
Active tab: {activeTab}

<Tabs
      tabs={[
        { value: "overview", label: "Overview" },
        { value: "analytics", label: "Analytics" },
        { value: "reports", label: "Reports" },
        { value: "notifications", label: "Notifications" },
        { value: "settings", label: "Settings" },
        { value: "billing", label: "Billing" },
      ]}
      selectedValue="overview"
    />

<Tabs
      tabs={[
        {
          value: "tab1",
          label: "Regular Tab",
        },
        {
          value: "tab2",
          label: "Link Tab",
          render: (props) => <a {...props} href="#tab2" />,
        },
        {
          value: "tab3",
          label: "Another Link",
          render: (props) => <a {...props} href="#tab3" />,
        },
      ]}
      selectedValue="tab1"
    />

Text.name: Text

variant.description:
Text style variant. Determines color, font, and weight.
- `"heading1"` — Large page title (30px, semibold)
- `"heading2"` — Section title (24px, semibold)
- `"heading3"` — Subsection title (18px, semibold)
- `"body"` — Default body text
- `"secondary"` — Muted text for secondary information
- `"success"` — Success state text
- `"error"` — Error state text
- `"mono"` — Monospace text for code
- `"mono-secondary"` — Muted monospace text

size.description:
Text size (only applies to body/secondary/success/error variants).
- `"xs"` — 12px
- `"sm"` — 14px
- `"base"` — 16px
- `"lg"` — 18px

bold.description: Whether to use bold font weight (only applies to body variants).

as.description: The HTML element type to render as (e.g. `"span"`, `"p"`, `"h1"`). Auto-selected based on variant if omitted.

examples:
Heading 1

text-3xl (30px)

Heading 2

text-2xl (24px)

Heading 3

text-lg (16px)

Body

text-base (14px)

Body bold

text-base (14px)

Body lg

text-lg (16px)

Body sm

text-sm (13px)

Body xs

text-xs (12px)

Body secondary

text-base (14px)

Monospace

text-sm (13px)

Monospace lg

text-base (14px)

Monospace secondary

text-sm (13px)

Success

text-base (14px)

Error

text-base (14px)

Toasty.name: Toasty
Toasty.description: Toasty — toast notification provider and viewport.  Renders a `Toast.Provider` with a fixed-position viewport in the bottom-right corner. Toasts stack with smooth enter/exit animations, swipe-to-dismiss, and expand-on-hover.  Built on `@base-ui/react/toast`.

Tooltip.name: Tooltip
Tooltip.description: Accessible popup that shows additional information on hover/focus. Wrap your app or section with `<TooltipProvider>` to enable delay grouping.

align.description:
Alignment on the axis perpendicular to `side`.
- `"start"` — Align to the start edge
- `"center"` — Center-aligned
- `"end"` — Align to the end edge

asChild.description: When `true`, the trigger wraps the child element instead of adding a wrapper.

side.description:
Preferred side of the trigger to render the tooltip.
- `"top"` — Tooltip appears above the trigger
- `"bottom"` — Tooltip appears below the trigger
- `"left"` — Tooltip appears to the left of the trigger
- `"right"` — Tooltip appears to the right of the trigger

descriptions.left: Tooltip appears to the left of the trigger
descriptions.right: Tooltip appears to the right of the trigger

content.description: Content to display in the tooltip

examples:
<TooltipProvider>
      <Tooltip content="Add new item" asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={PlusIcon} aria-label="Add new item" />
      </Tooltip>
    </TooltipProvider>

<TooltipProvider>
      <Tooltip content="Add" asChild>
        <Button shape="square" icon={PlusIcon} aria-label="Add" />
      </Tooltip>
    </TooltipProvider>

InputArea.name: InputArea
InputArea.description: Multi-line textarea input with Input variants and InputArea-specific dimensions

DeleteResource.name: DeleteResource

descriptions.sm: Small dialog for simple delete confirmations

resourceType.description: The type of resource being deleted (e.g., "Zone", "Worker", "KV Namespace")

resourceName.description: The name of the specific resource being deleted

isDeleting.description: Whether the delete action is in progress

caseSensitive.description: Whether the confirmation input should be case-sensitive (default: true)

errorMessage.description: Error message to display if the delete action fails

examples:
<>
      <Button variant="destructive" onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>
        Delete Zone
      </Button>
      <DeleteResource
        open={open}
        onOpenChange={setOpen}
        resourceType="Zone"
        resourceName="example.com"
        onDelete={handleDelete}
        isDeleting={isDeleting}
      />
    </>

<>
      <Button variant="destructive" onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>
        Delete Worker
      </Button>
      <DeleteResource
        open={open}
        onOpenChange={setOpen}
        resourceType="Worker"
        resourceName="api-gateway-worker"
        onDelete={handleDelete}
        isDeleting={isDeleting}
      />
    </>

<>
      <Button variant="destructive" onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>
        Delete Zone
      </Button>
      <DeleteResource
        open={open}
        onOpenChange={setOpen}
        resourceType="Zone"
        resourceName="example.com"
        onDelete={handleDelete}
        isDeleting={isDeleting}
        errorMessage={errorMsg}
      />
    </>

PageHeader.name: PageHeader

descriptions.relaxed: Relaxed spacing for more prominent headers

examples:
<PageHeader
      className="w-full"
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link icon={<HouseIcon size={16} />} href="#">
            Workers & Pages
          </Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>cloudflare-dev-platform</Breadcrumbs.Current>

      tabs={[
        { label: "Overview", value: "overview" },

        { label: "Bindings", value: "bindings" },
        { label: "Observability", value: "observability" },
        { label: "Settings", value: "settings" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="overview"
      onValueChange={(v) => console.log(v)}
    >

        Edit code
      </Button>
      <Button icon={<GlobeIcon />} variant="primary" className="h-8">
        Visit

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={

          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Dashboard</Breadcrumbs.Current>

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={

          </Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current icon={<GearIcon size={16} />}>
            Settings
          </Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={

          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Settings</Breadcrumbs.Current>

        { label: "General", value: "general" },

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={

          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Projects</Breadcrumbs.Link>

      breadcrumbs={

        </Breadcrumbs>

    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Products</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Current>Page title</Breadcrumbs.Current>
        </Breadcrumbs>
      }
      title="Page title"
      description="Action-led, value-oriented description of what this page does. Optional second sentence with use cases or prerequisites."
    />

<PageHeader
      breadcrumbs={
        <Breadcrumbs>
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Home</Breadcrumbs.Link>
          <Breadcrumbs.Separator />
          <Breadcrumbs.Link href="#">Products</Breadcrumbs.Link>

        </Breadcrumbs>
      }

      tabs={[
        { label: "Overview", value: "overview" },
        { label: "Analytics", value: "analytics" },
        { label: "Settings", value: "settings" },
      ]}
      defaultTab="overview"
    >

        Export
      </Button>
      <Button variant="primary" size="sm" icon={<PlusIcon size={16} />}>
        New Item
      </Button>
    </PageHeader>
